task_summary: Open the lower cabinet door in a kitchen setting using a robot arm to locate, grasp, and pull the door by its handle.

task_long_description.overview: This episode takes place in a kitchen environment, where a robot arm is tasked to open the cabinet door beneath the countertop. The robot must first visually detect the cabinet handle, then approach and precisely align over it. The system opens the gripper, computes a side grasp pose, safely executes a grasp, then pulls the door open by moving in the correct direction. The sequence assumes a known handle location and door type; it is constrained by available visual cues and the presence of a gripper with adequate width.
preconditions: Cabinet handle is unobstructed and within field of view
Robot is initialized and at home/start position
stepwise_plan: Check handle is visible; scan if not
Align to the handle with tight tolerance
Open gripper in preparation for grasping
Compute grasp pose for handle (side strategy)
Pull cabinet door in correct direction by 0.15 meters
success_criteria: No damage to door or handle
Robot is no longer grasping handle (post-pull, if required)
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect handle: retry scan up to 3 times
Failed grasp: abort mission or retry from approach
No gripper contact detected: retry align/grasp
task_long_description.termination: Task completes when the cabinet door is verified as open or upon unrecoverable failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the cabinet handle is visible in current frame.
Scans for the cabinet handle if not initially visible; up to 3 attempts.
Runs precise detection/localization of the cabinet handle.
Moves robot end-effector above cabinet handle with 5cm offset.
Approaches and aligns to handle with tight (5mm) tolerance.
Opens gripper to 8cm to prepare for grasping the handle.
Computes a side-grasp pose on the handle and places it in the blackboard.
Executes grasp at the previously computed pose with side strategy.
Pulls the cabinet door open by 15cm in the +y direction.
Checks if the cabinet door is open.

failure_modes: Cabinet handle not detected after allowed scans
recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times on visibility loss
Abort if persistent grasp or alignment failure
assumptions: The instruction refers to a 'carbinet door', assumed to mean the visible cabinet's lower door
Door pulls open at ~90 degrees to robot, consistent with visual frames

expected_success_criteria: cabinet door visually and physically open at end of sequence
